titleStmt.title: A True relation of the late battell neere Newbery. Shewing the happy successe of his Excellencies forces against the cavaliers, upon Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, with the manner of their fight, and how many slaine, and taken prisoners on both sides. Also how his Majesty and the prince standing on a hill neere, and viewing the said fight, concluded that it was a worse bout then Edge-hill. With a perfect relation of the taking of Cyrencester, the number of prisoners, horses, armes, ammunition, and provisions. As it was sent in a letter from one in the army, to his friend in London, dated from their quarters in Reading, 23 of September, 1643.
titleStmt.author: T. V.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Wright, in the Old-Bailey,

notesStmt.note: "From our quarters at Reading Sept. 23, 1643." signed T.V.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
